definition: to weigh the pros and cons (idiom)

sentences.english: This is the part of the brain we use to weigh the pros and cons or engage our "expertise."
sentences.chinese: 这部分大脑用来权衡利弊或利用“经验”。

sentences.english: I commor to weigh the pros or cons ago a decision.
sentences.chinese: 在做决定之前，我必需权衡利弊得失。

sentences.english: I need to weigh the pros and cons before making a decision.
sentences.chinese: 在做决定之前，偶必须权衡利弊得失。

sentences.english: They weighed the advantages and disadvantages before making the decision.
sentences.chinese: 他们权衡利弊之后才作出决定。

sentences.english: One must balance risk versus benefit.
sentences.chinese: 使用该药，患者必须权衡利弊。

sentences.english: In examining the plan, we must weigh the advantages and disadvantages.
sentences.chinese: 在审查计划时，我们必须权衡利弊。

sentences.english: Selecting good bits requires understanding how critters use space and weighing competing claims for it.
sentences.chinese: 选择好地点需要知道生物如何利用空间并权衡利弊。

sentences.english: I command to weigh the pros and cons ago making a decision.
sentences.chinese: 在做决定之前，我必需权衡利弊得失。

sentences.english: I am very protective of my time and weigh the pros and cons of everything I do.
sentences.chinese: 我很保护我的时候，权衡利弊得失一切，我做的。

definition: to consider/to weigh (a matter)/to balance (pros and cons)
pros and cons/merits and drawbacks/advantages and disadvantages
think three times then go (idiom); don't act before you've thought it through carefully
to judge the hour and size up the situation/to take stock
to consider past cause and future effect (idiom); to think over the past and future/to ponder over reasons and connection
think again and again before acting (idiom); consider carefully in advance
to make a decision when it's time to decide
to look forward and back/to consider prudently/overcautious
